channel.title: Pages on Lane for Webfirm
channel.description: Recent content in Pages on Lane for Webfirm

item.title: Cover Letter
item.description:
Wow Webfirm! I’m excited to be pitching you, and I don’t use exclamation marks lightly…


I was less excited to learn I’d emailed Erika on Wednesday with her name spelt wrong; twice. Sorry Erika! So I promised to impress with my job application and I hope this one makes up for my typo: enough so that I get to email Erika more in the future, forever spelling Erika with a ‘k’ not a ‘c’.


Only 24 hours after my email fail Lane for Webfirm was live online. This dedicated website application was born to showcase some of my skills, personality, and desire to work with you.


Briefly I’m a complete digital creative suite wrapped in a single caring, sharing soul. ‘For good’ fuels my heart and good coffee fuels everything else. Being a great writer and communicator is just the start though — my passion, compassion, and people skills are greater again.


Broadly I’m a brilliant writer, communicator, and conceptualist with bonus website management and coding skills, strong social media nous, advanced analytical and optimisation skills (including website performance, mobile web performance, Google Analytics, and Google Adwords), email marketing and e-commerce experience, plus a photographic eye and Photoshop skills. I’m also apt in minimising online operating costs while maximising online operating returns. But even greater than my professional skills are my personal skills… and I don’t use adverbs lightly either.


I too am open to a job share arrangement: balanced work-life matters to me.


In the next few pages you’ll find my resume, referees, and learn more about me. I hope you’ll also see how my personal and professional skills combined with my growth mindset and autodidact instincts offer us both the chance to quench my thirst to learn.

item.title: About Me
item.description:
Hi I’m Lane — a haloumi whore and affogato addict who dreams of liberation and llama farming. I’ll love you forever if you’ll just read me aloud DFW’s Infinite Jest… a book I’ve owned forever but never read. If you’re not down for David can we fly to Tokyo, suck down saké, and sing karaoke until sunrise?

Music and art are the way to my heart when cheese and coffee aren’t appropriate. I’m real and really on Twitter @THINKLN.

Nb: I don’t understand footy, fishing, or photos with tied-up tigers in Thailand.


Above is my Tinder profile; verbatim. I strive to be 100% me in every aspect of my life and I say if you can’t use your Tinder profile as a sample of your writing you’re either a weak writer, a liar, or both.


Below are my Twitter photos: @THINKLN is where I share some of my wit, work, and moments that make me “me”.

item.title: I Write, Create, and Conceptualise
item.description: I’m a brilliant writer, creator, and conceptualist.

item.title: I Code, Optimise, and Analyse
item.description:
Writing’s my greatest love but not my only skill — I have a bunch of others that gift me great insight into much bigger brand and business puzzles. Such skills allow me to see how different pieces compliment each other, and why, sometimes, compromises must be made.



I Code

I hand-built this website using some of the best tools in the business, including…

  • CloudFlare: Power, protection, and encryption. For free.
  • Hugo: A static web engine written in Go language. Also free.
  • Github: Version control and static website hosting. Free.
  • Bootstrap: A responsive, mobile-first website framework. Free too.



I Optimise, Analyse, & Socialise

I’m skilled in and experienced with the following tools, technologies, and trades…

  • SEO: Search Engine Optimisation; getting Google love.
  • PPC: Pay Per Click; Google Ads (and others).
  • Content: Content generation and optimisation.
  • WordPress: Advanced WordPress admin, management, development, and hosting. Including WordPress Multisite.
  • Other CMS: Ghost, Magento, Joomla, and more
  • E-commerce: Development and management including Shopify and Squarespace
  • Social Media: Twitter, Instagram, Hootsuite, etc.
  • Graphics: Photoshop, Illustrator, Affinity, and more.
  • Analytics: Google Analytics, Google Webmaster Tools, Gaug.es, etc.
  • Optimisation: Optimizely and other A/B testing tools
  • Website Performance: Pagespeed, minification, concatenation, etc.
  • Email Marketing: Mailchimp et. al.

item.title: I Push, Practise, and Exercise
item.description:
Away from work I love to run — running is my thing. Before I ran I rode, competitively, winning some great races and beating some great riders. I find physical challenge as rewarding as the creative kind and pushing my mind and body ultimately brings out the best in both. I once rode 3,300km (solo!) in 21 days for a personal challenge (raising money for charity along the way). Currently I practice mindfulness, run regularly, drink rarely, drug never, fast intermittently, and Wim Hof daily (per video below).



tl;dw — Wimm Hof is redefining the science of human physiology through the power of his mind. It’s almost unbelievable (and I don’t use adverbs lightly! Or do I?). Part of Wim’s daily routine is cold water therapy. It’s also part of mine.


When I’m not running, writing, or shivering Iceman-style I can be found strumming a ukulele, solving a Rubik’s Cube, or streaming a podcast or two. I love to learn. Learning sign language (Auslan Level I and II) has been a highlight in recent times and it’s a skill I’m desperate to keep practising and improving. Sign language, like other languages and communication forms, connects people, and I love that too.

item.title: Photography
item.description: I love photography. PHACES is personal growth project of mine and while the focus appears to be on those in front of the lens the real focus is always behind it. Nevertheless is showcases my handiness with a camera too: www.phac.es (this links to my PHACES Twitter account where it’s easiest to see the photos).

item.title: Criterias
item.description:
Essential Criteria

  1. Are you a highly motivated recent graduate in Marketing or Journalism (or have equivalent experience?)
    Yes.

  2. Can you demonstrate a passion for technology and digital marketing?
    Yes. And this dedicated, online application is just the start…

  3. Are you familiar with Wordpress, Google Analytics, blogging, email marketing, social media, or search engine optimisation?
    I am very familiar with WordPress (coding, hosting, management, optimisation, and updates; including WordPress MultiSite), Google Analytics, blogging, email marketing, social media, and search engine optimisation too.



Desired Criteria

  1. Extra points for Table Tennis skills!
    I’m not the best player in the world but my love of the game is unbeatable. I’m very willing to be the offical Webfirm and Adslot table tennis training and practice partner for all/any staff and/or visitors! And I don’t use adverbs lightly!

item.title: BLURBMSITH
item.description:
A Blurbsmith paints a thousand words in only nine.
—BLURBSMITH


BLURBSMITH is a moniker of mine born to burn excess creativity.

item.title: CONCISELY
item.description: #WordsWithin is a playful new series I’m sending out to the social medias via CONCISELY — my freelance copywriting service.

item.title: Lane For Webfirm Reviews
item.description:
I loved Lane For Webfirm; you’re such an unique talent. Would you relocate to Brisbane for the right role?

— Danielle Duell. CEO, PEOPLE WITH PURPOSE



What an awesome application. I’d hire you without even interviewing you.

— Jay Stockwell. Head of Marketing, Nimble



The difference is you care.

— Spyro Kalos. Manager, AMTA (Australian Mobile Telecommunications Association)



Have they hired you yet? You’re definitely the best person for the job.

— My Mum (as unbiased as ever)

item.title: Contact Me
item.description:
Thanks for reading Lane for Webfirm. This ambitious endeavour was presented to showcase passion and potential over perfectionism and not just becasue I spelt Erika’s name wrong twice in my introduction email. But again Erika, sorry about that!

I’m new to Melbourne, full of enthusiasm, and available to interview and start work immediately. Please call or message me any time.


Always,
Lane

0488 48 24 24 · lane@maily.pro · @THINKLN
